Posts.Content: Firstly happy New Year to all . Lets hope for continuing health and happiness in amongst all of this craziness . I have now finished Chemo waiting for rads and the 5 year endocrine therapy. ........ I thought I would share Christmas presents the least thought out and a more thought out one , just as a bit of light relief . Having just finished chemo and sitting with a lovely sheen on my head , my least thought out one was a lovely shampoo and conditioner set , which might have been ok if the person had said this is for when your hair comes back , but no ......the look on her face when I opened it and she realised what she had done I just howled with laughter . She did eventually , she must still visualise me with hair !!! My more thought out one was 4 bags of coal put into the outhouse when I was out and a card through the door which simply said warm your toes with this , I had been saying to this friend that I was feeling the cold more recently and how expensive coal was but how much I liked my real fire . Obviously I was very grateful for both gifts but it did make me smile ........ Onward and upwards Ladies and Gents .
Posts.Title: Christmas presents did you really think this out

Posts.Content: I would love to know too I keep telling my friends when they tell me how well I look ie fat .its great with this cancer treatment you put on weight in spite of having bits chopped off , loose your hair , and when the hair comes back its whiskers and nasal first with a couple of Dennis Healy eyebrow hairs which I have had to trim , I have a reverse Brazilian very attractive look , but I am here in all my glory that's the main thing . Onward and upwards !! Fiona
Posts.Title: how to lose weight on tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Hi , had first one Wednesday , today I can taste things again !!! Tea coffee and milky things were non no's but warm juice and herbal teas ok ,loads of water extra pillows as bit of gastric burn when flat . Was like being pregnant no strong smells certainly not your favourite perfume ........ You'll never wear it again . Plain crackers or tuc to keep something on your tummy every hour or so helped me with the nausea . Sucking crystallised ginger too . Still couldn't face an egg , but not sleeping as much in the last two days . Good wishes .
Posts.Title: Suggestions for a chemo survival tool kit please!

Posts.Content: Hi there lost my right boob too after wide local excision margin too close for comfort . I was just pleased to get rid of anything that might have been left . I always had huge boobs and had reduction on left when I had the first surgery plus node clearance . I was lucky my surgeon was happy to put a silicone implant in so I have what I think of as a half breast and a whole one but you can't really tell when I am dressed . I don't have a significant other to worry about and I probably wouldn't anyway . I am pleased with the result I have no nipple but have joked with mates I can always use a jelly tot ........ Handy for any diabetic emergencies !!! I was all for recon using Dieppe flap later , but now i am not even sure I want to bother , having said that I am still going thro chemo etc , may become more important later . So to summarise I am ok with it hope you will be too . Let me know how you get on .Fiona
Posts.Title: Mx operation

Posts.Content: Sorry to hear in nodes too , still plenty of things they can do , I am having the famous FEC then radiotherapy , have nodes affected too . It's a better feeling when they get on with things and you have a plan . Still crappy but more control . Just read some of the stuff people have written on here and you realise there are " more ways to skin a cat " oh god I sound like my mother ....... Head up and into the next round . You will get there . Fiona .
Posts.Title: lymph node clearance

Posts.Content: Hi it is usually base line observations. Bp pulse heart rate . May doEEG if you have not had a recent one , routine bloods , they may cross match you in case you need a top up . MRSA swabs urine testing height weight etc for anaesthetic . Go thro previous medical history , check how you will manage at home post . Ie who can help you . They may measure you for post op bra . Your opportunity to ask questions re anything bothering you . Usually access to an anaesthetist. Probably wont be the one doing your surgery but available if any concerns re anaesthetic . It's a bit like a winter service making sure they have all your information prior to setting off on the next bit of your journey so you get to your destination without any surprises or slippy roads . May I wish you all the best for your surgery and for the season .
Posts.Title: Pre-Op Assessment

Posts.Content: Hi , I am not a regular replier !! But do look every day at the site , I don't have to face what you are facing at the moment , but as you say who knows what is around the corner for me .I wanted to say that it is impossible not to wobble every now and again , and with what you have been through I am amazed at your strengh so far . My breast cancer diagnosis was in a long line of other life crap , it was the icing on the cake and I too just wonder what is next . You have some great support as you say and lots of people here seem to talk sense , I hope you find someone here who can help you with a similar story , but if you want to chat or vent whatever you are welcome to private message me you dont always want to talk to someone close .
Posts.Title: Need some comforting words too.

Posts.Content: It's right , do not waste any of your energy on this woman you have nothing to prove , does she fancy him???? The big old world is out there for you again you have taken a back step for a while , you don't need to anymore . If he is worth anything he will know what is real and what is not . People like that drain your positive energy , don't let them . Head up , big smile , bring it on ....... You are master of your destiny again .
Posts.Title: Accused of making it up

Posts.Content: Glad you feel the same as me highland mum , I do feel positive it is not trying to be anything other than how I feel . I certainly don't feel I am suppressing any emotions . I hope it continues , good luck on your journey onward and upwards .
Posts.Title: Feel like I am back at square one

Posts.Content: Hi just wanted to say how good you look in twiggy , it's so nice to put a face to the person who's posting . My wig will be up for sale in a few weeks too its great slowly coming back to some normality . At the start I wondered if I would ge through it all . Good luck and best wishes. Fiona
Posts.Title: Twiggy's up for sale (my wig :-)) )

Posts.Content: Hi ,have been reading the threads since diagnosis in June and various bits of surgery . Now big Chemo day tomorrow , do I need to suck ice on FEC ? Gone a bit dizzy blonde , had a supper for friends last night and wig try on have got blonde red and brown so maybe a throw back from that ! Have decided to use them like hats in the winter ,also got a faux fur trapper hat which covers my eyebrows and is sooo cozy . Do have the desire to be a bit naughty and whip the wigs / hats on and off when out and about and as a friend said skin it !!!! I admire how people are in the main so positive and glass half full it certainly inspires me to remain in the onward and upwards mode and as has been said keep ticking the various stages off ...........
Posts.Title: First FEC in the morning !!!

Posts.Content: Hi after Mx and ANC FEC chemo I am starting Rads on the 17 th this thread has been great as many of my questions have now been answered . I would like to keep in touch with others at the same stage . I am in the Newcastle area is anyone else ? Fiona
Posts.Title: Last hurdle!!!!!

Posts.Content: Woken up with headache and feeling like I have cold ,chemo due this morning will they do it?....?...?...
Posts.Title: Will they do chemo with a cold?

Posts.Content: Just had to post as I have done it ...... Two lots of surgery ,Chemo and my last radiotherapy session this afternoon . I have met some wonderful people and had some horrendous problems but its done apart from the five years of endocrine therapy . Now dancing my way to the freezer for a celebratory strawberry ice cream . Thanks to all who have helped along the way . I never thought at the start it would end but it does and it feels good . Fiona
Posts.Title: Done it !!

Posts.Content: Hi I had MX on the 4th my wound has almost healed now and would be suprised to have any leakage . Is the fluid smelly at all , is there any redness or inflammation , is the area warmer than usual also what colour is the fluid . ? Think it's important to have it checked . Everybody heals at at a different rate and it could be serous fluid from lymph , but the wound itself is worth a look to make sure it is healing as expected . I had WLE 4 weeks before went for MX and did get some fat necrosis which was sticky and almost greasy looking fluid from the wound but there has been nothing with the last surgery . I am hopeless always need to know the far end of a fart , and ask the BCN a lot of questions , but they always say they would rather be contacted about anything than have me worrying. Would love to know how you get on .
Posts.Title: Wound still leaking after MX
